Class MapContext

java.lang.Object
com.javax0.logiqua.engine.MapContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.javax0.logiqua.Context
public class MapContext extends Object implements com.javax0.logiqua.Context
The MapContext class is an implementation of the Context interface that uses a Map as the underlying data structure to store key-value pairs. It provides methods to access and navigate through the stored values for a given key.

The keys can be structural, containing 

    key.subkey

style access to map elements and arrays as 

    key[index]

The implementation is liberal, key.3 will return the value of the fourth element of the array and also key[subkey] will return the value of the subkey.

The implementation handles anything

  • anything that is an object of a class that implements the interface (ATIAOOACTITI) Context
  • ATIAOOACTITI Map
  • ATIAOOACTITI List
  • ATIAOOACTITI Collection
  • ATIAOOACTITI Iterable
  • anything that is a Java array Object[]

The MapContext class also maintains two proxies for Context.MappedProxyFactory and Context.IndexedProxyFactory interfaces. Any class implementing one of these interfaces with an instance registered with the MapContext will be used to handle access to an object that is not meeting any of the above conditions (not a Map, not a List, etc.).

    • caster

      public <From,To> Optional<com.javax0.logiqua.Context.Caster<From,To>> caster(Class<From> fromClass, Class<To> toClass)
      Retrieves a caster capable of converting objects from the specified source type to the specified target type. The method checks for primitive-to-wrapper conversions, exact type matches, or a registered caster in the internal registry. If the target type is String and no caster is found, a default implementation casting the object to a string is returned..
      Specified by:
      caster in interface com.javax0.logiqua.Context
      Type Parameters:
      From - the generic type representing the source type
      To - the generic type representing the target type
      Parameters:
      fromClass - the Class representing the source type of the objects to be converted
      toClass - the Class representing the target type of the conversion
      Returns:
      a Caster instance capable of converting objects of type From to type To, or null if no appropriate caster is found and the target type is not String

    • accessor

      public com.javax0.logiqua.Context.Proxy accessor(Object target)
      Retrieves a Context.ProxyFactory proxy for the specified target object. The method first attempts to retrieve a map-like proxy; if unavailable, it falls back to retrieving a list-like proxy.
      Specified by:
      accessor in interface com.javax0.logiqua.Context
      Parameters:
      target - the object for which the Context.ProxyFactory proxy is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a Context.ProxyFactory proxy for the specified target, or null if neither map-like nor list-like proxy is found
